qas.question: Which constitution gave legislative power to protect intellectual property?
When did the Paris and Berne administrative secretariats merge?
What name did the merged secretariats adopt?

answers.text: United International Bureaux for the Protection of Intellectual Property

qas.question: What constitution epressly protected intellectual propert?
What position was established by the Paris convention in 1886 and the Berne Convention 1883?
Secretaties from what convention merged with the secrataries of the Paris Convention  in 1886?
Who located in Paris after merging in 1893?

plausible_answers.text: the United International Bureaux for the Protection of Intellectual Property

qas.question: What name was adopted by the administrative secretatioes from the Berne Convention?

context: The German equivalent was used with the founding of <a0_0>the <b5_0>North German Confederation<b5_0/><a0_0/> whose constitution granted legislative power over the protection of intellectual property (Schutz des geistigen Eigentums) to the confederation. When <b6_0>the <b8_0>administrative secretariats<b8_0/><b6_0/> established by the Paris Convention (<a1_0>1883<a1_0/>) and the <b7_0>Berne Convention<b7_0/> (<a2_0>1886<a2_0/>) merged in <a3_0>1893<a3_0/>, they located in Berne, and also adopted the term intellectual property in their new combined title, <b9_0>the <a4_0>United International Bureaux for the Protection of Intellectual Property<b9_0/><a4_0/>.
